content: No-one actually know why they banned Savage, not least because as far as anyone can tell he never had any intention of visiting the UK. There was a moderately amusing item on the end of Newsnight tonight in which a government MP tried - and failed miserably - to defend this ban. It was pointed out that while Savage is patently a complete and utter arrsehole of the first water. He is nothing more than a bit of a gobshi'ite and that unlike Americans most Britons, regardless of political affiliation (even many Sun readers!) would - after listening to his rants - simply say, "w@^k£r" and ignore him. Most of the what he comes out with is after all self-evidently bollocks. In fact nobody had ever heard of Savage until this. It will be interesting to see what he says if he ever gets his day in court, while he's probably not as bad as any of the others on the Home Office's D-List any barrister worth his salt will make him look a complete git.
